name: The Lonely Grave
tagline: Dotted with ancient earth-workings: mounds, ridges, and rings.
description: Dotted with ancient earth-workings: mounds, ridges, and rings. As characters travel along the bleak ridge of the Table Downs, the moaning of the wind takes on a voice-like quality, as if carrying shouted warnings from afar.

points_of_interest.name: Moaning Wind
points_of_interest.description: As characters travel along the bleak ridge of the Table Downs, the moaning of the wind takes on a voice-like quality, as if carrying shouted warnings from afar.
points_of_interest.exploring: If PCs stop to listen: They catch the name of the character with the highest Wisdom in the erratic, ominous wailing.
special_features: Wind carries name of PC with highest Wisdom

points_of_interest.name: The Lonely Grave
points_of_interest.description: A simple, weatherworn headstone is visible beneath the eaves of a serene copse at the base of a hill.
points_of_interest.exploring: Inscription: The name of the PC with the highest Wisdom is inexplicably carved onto the gravestone, along with the epitaph "Lord of the Wild." Examining: The stone appears to be many centuries old. The ground around is overgrown and undisturbed. Unearthing: A decaying coffin is buried 3â€² down. Inside is a skeleton of the same physical proportions as the PC whose name the headstone bears. Its skull is smashed in. Two objects lie on its breast (see Grave Treasures).

roll_tables.name: Grave Treasures
roll_tables.description: Two objects found on the skeleton's breast

entries.title: Silver knife
entries.description: Engraved with Liturgic script only visible in moonlight. The script read "For the glory of God." The knife is actually a Holy Longsword (Shrinking, p412). The Liturgic inscription, if uttered by a Lawful character, causes the blade to grow or shrink.
entries.mechanical_effect: Liturgic inscription causes blade to grow or shrink when uttered by Lawful character

entries.title: Brass ring
entries.description: Inscribed with very fine lines in the shape of frost patterns. It is a Ring of Energy Resistance (Cold, p410) of fairy make. A mortal who possesses it also comes under a glamour causing them to giggle ominously in their sleep, disturbing the rest of any nearby.
entries.mechanical_effect: Mortal possessor giggles ominously in sleep, disturbing nearby rest

special_features: Headstone bears name of PC with highest Wisdom
Skeleton matches proportions of named PC
secrets: If skeleton or objects are taken, named PC is cursed with nightmare spectre attack

items.name: Holy Longsword (Shrinking)
items.description: Silver knife engraved with Liturgic script only visible in moonlight. The script reads "For the glory of God." The Liturgic inscription, if uttered by a Lawful character, causes the blade to grow or shrink.
items.mechanical_effect: Grows or shrinks when Liturgic inscription uttered by Lawful character

items.name: Ring of Energy Resistance (Cold)
items.description: Brass ring inscribed with very fine lines in the shape of frost patterns. Of fairy make.
items.mechanical_effect: Energy resistance to cold. Mortal possessor giggles ominously in sleep, disturbing nearby rest

secrets: Cursed: If the skeleton or the objects are taken from this place, the PC whose name is engraved on the headstone comes under a curse. The next time they sleep in a house or inn, they experience a nightmare wherein they are attacked by a spectre whispering "Lord of the Wild." If the PC is defeated, their companions discover them in the morning, dead, with their head smashed in.
